title: [Medicine] After 80 Years, Medical Mystery Behind Infant Deaths Is Finally Solved. ~10% of infantile hypercalcemia type 1 cases lacking CYP24A1 mutations are caused by misfolding from 3' UTR abnormalities. The condition was linked to a number of infant deaths from kidney damage in the '30s and '40s.
[Health] Researchers unravel why episodes of low blood sugar worsen eye disease in people with diabetes
